instrument: Parliamentary Assembly Resolution 2343 on the need for democratic governance of artificial intelligence
description: Parliamentary Assembly urges member states not to grant legal personality to AI systems or robots and to ensure human accountability.

instrument: European Parliament Resolution on Civil Law Rules on Robotics
description: Non-binding resolution suggesting the creation of an "electronic person" status for sophisticated autonomous robots to allocate rights and obligations.

instrument: Regulation (EU) 2024/1689 laying down harmonised rules on artificial intelligence (AI Act)
description: Risk-based regulatory regime that treats AI systems as tools and places obligations on human or legal person deployers rather than conferring independent legal personality.
Allows decentralized autonomous organizations to register as limited liability companies whose governance is executed via smart contracts.

instrument: SF0038 - Decentralized Autonomous Organization Supplement to the Wyoming LLC Act
description: Enables DAO formation as Wyoming LLCs with smart contracts serving as the operating agreement and clarifies member liability protections.

instrument: Public Chapter No. 994 amending the Tennessee Limited Liability Company Act
description: Recognizes decentralized autonomous organizations as LLCs and permits smart contract governance provisions in formation documents.
Creates the "Utah DAO" legal entity type that may own property, enter contracts, and be governed in whole or part by smart contracts.
Authorizes LLCs with blockchain-based governance features subject to human fiduciary duties and compliance controls.

instrument: Innovative Technology Arrangements and Services Act (Cap. 592)
description: Provides for certification and recognition of technology arrangements, including DAO-style governance structures, under oversight of the Malta Digital Innovation Authority.
Three-year program offering legal guidance to DLT projects, including pilots addressing DAO governance and digital personhood questions.
Provides datasets and supervisory feedback for testing AI-driven financial and autonomous agent solutions under regulatory oversight.

instrument: MAS FinTech Regulatory Sandbox and Sandbox Express
description: Sandbox regimes that allow experimentation with AI and decentralized governance solutions within limited customer exposure and bespoke safeguards.

jurisdiction: United Arab Emirates - Abu Dhabi Global Market
instrument: Digital Securities Sandbox and DLT Foundations framework
description: Enables controlled testing of tokenized and autonomous governance structures and provides a path to incorporate DLT foundations with smart-contract bylaws.
